Instruction: In a large bowl, cream together the butter, sugar, and vanilla extract until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.

In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, 2 tablespoons of sugar, and salt. Use a pastry blender or fork to cut the butter into the flour mixture until it resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add the eggs and cream to create a firm dough. Transfer the mixture to a lightly floured surface and knead briefly until the dough holds together.
Bake in the preheated oven until the tops are lightly golden, about 15 to 20 minutes.
Bake at 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) for 12 to 15 minutes, or until they turn golden brown.
